intro: Phlegmariurus gnidioides, commonly known as the gnidioid shield fern, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with a dense, cushion-like growth habit and a dark green, leathery thallus. Its reproductive structures, known as gemmae, are produced in clusters on the upper surface of the thallus. This liverwort is often found in temperate regions and is characterized by its ability to thrive in humid, nutrient-rich substrates.
